definition: Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) is a communication protocol used for discovering the link layer address associated with a given internet layer address.

claims.claim: ARP maps IP addresses to MAC addresses on local networks
ARP uses broadcast messages to discover unknown MAC addresses
ARP cache stores IP-to-MAC mappings to avoid repeated broadcasts

d4e5f6789012345678901234567890abcdef1234.content: ARP is used to dynamically build and maintain a mapping table between IP addresses and Ethernet addresses.

e5f6789012345678901234567890abcdef123456.content: ARP uses broadcast messages to discover the Ethernet address of a target IP address.

f6789012345678901234567890abcdef12345678.content: ARP maintains a cache of recent IP-to-Ethernet address mappings to avoid repeated broadcasts.
